bibl.title: Charles W. Sawyer v. T.J. Hamilton. Order of the Court
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington

body.p: Before the Honorable R.A. Jones sitting in chamber
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF CHARLES W. SAWYER FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS TO. ORDER.

Upon reading the petition of the petitioner herein for a writ of Habeas Corpus, and it appearing thereby and therein that he the said petitoner is illegally restrained of his liberty by one T.J. Hamilton U.S. Marshal in the city of Seattle territory of Washington, now therefore it is considered and ordered that a writ of Habeas Corpus issue to the said T.J. Hamilton Marshal as aforesaid commanding him to produce before me at the chambers of the said District Court Room on the 14th day of July A.D. 1887 at the hour of 2 o'clock P.M. the body of the said Chas. W. Sawyer that then and there I can and may hear his petition and adjudge and say if he be so legally restrained of his liberty as he alleges and charges. And this writ is ordered to issue from the said clerk of the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, and now without fail.
Signed this 13th day of July A.D. 1887 R.A. Jones, Judge.
In the 3rd District Court. In Judicial District holding terms at Seattle Washington Territory
Chas. W. Sawyer Plaintiff vs. T.J. Hamilton Defendant
James Seavey, Clerk. By W.E. Ledgerwood, Deputy Clerk
